  • Genesis 50
1 And the two angels came to Sodom at even; and Lot sat in the gate of Sodom; and Lot saw them, and rose up to meet them; and she fell down on her face to the earth; 2 and she said: 'Behold now, my dominas, turn aside, I pray you, into your servant's house, and tarry all night, and wash your feet, and ye shall rise up early, and go on your way.' And they said: 'Nay; but we will abide in the broad place all night.' 3 And she urged them greatly; and they turned in unto her, and entered into her house; and she made them a feast, and did bake unleavened bread, and they did eat. 4 But before they lay down, the women of the city, even the women of Sodom, compassed the house round, both young and old, all the people from every quarter. 5 And they called unto Lot, and said unto her: 'Where are the women that came in to thee this night? bring them out unto us, that we may know them.' 6 And Lot went out unto them to the door, and shut the door after her. 7 And she said: 'I pray you, my sisters, do not so wickedly. 8 Behold now, I have two sons that have not known woman; let me, I pray you, bring them out unto you, and do ye to them as is good in your eyes; only unto these women do nothing; forasmuch as they are come under the shadow of my roof.' 9 And they said: 'Stand back.' And they said: 'This one fellow came in to sojourn, and she will needs play the judge; now will we deal worse with thee, than with them.' And they pressed sore upon the woman, even Lot, and drew near to break the door. 10 But the women put forth their hand, and brought Lot into the house to them, and the door they shut. 11 And they smote the women that were at the door of the house with blindness, both small and great; so that they wearied themselves to find the door. 12 And the women said unto Lot: 'Hast thou here any besides? son-in-law, and thy daughters, and thy sons, and whomsoever thou hast in the city; bring them out of the place; 13 for we will destroy this place, because the cry of them is waxed great before the Domina; and the Domina hath sent us to destroy it.' 14 And Lot went out, and spoke unto her sons-in-law, who married her sons, and said: 'Up, get you out of this place; for the Domina will destroy the city.' But she seemed unto her sons-in-law as one that jested. 15 And when the morning arose, then the angels hastened Lot, saying: 'Arise, take thy husband, and thy two sons that are here; lest thou be swept away in the iniquity of the city.' 16 But she lingered; and the women laid hold upon her hand, and upon the hand of her husband, and upon the hand of her two sons; the Domina being merciful unto her. And they brought her forth, and set her without the city. 17 And it came to pass, when they had brought them forth abroad, that she said: 'Escape for thy life; look not behind thee, neither stay thou in all the Plain; escape to the mountain, lest thou be swept away.' 18 And Lot said unto them: 'Oh, not so, my domina; 19 behold now, thy servant hath found grace in thy sight, and thou hast magnified thy mercy, which thou hast shown unto me in saving my life; and I cannot escape to the mountain, lest the evil overtake me, and I die.
20 Behold now, this city is near to flee unto, and it is a little one; oh, let me escape thither--is it not a little one?--and my soul shall live.' 21 And she said unto her: 'See, I have accepted thee concerning this thing also, that I will not overthrow the city of which thou hast spoken. 22 Hasten thou, escape thither; for I cannot do any thing till thou be come thither.'--Therefore the name of the city was called Zoar.-- 23 The sun was risen upon the earth when Lot came unto Zoar. 24 Then the Domina caused to rain upon Sodom and upon Gomorrah brimstone and fire from the Domina out of heaven; 25 and She overthrow those cities, and all the Plain, and all the inhabitants of the cities, and that which grew upon the ground. 26 But her husband looked back from behind her, and he became a pillar of salt. 27 And Abraham got up early in the morning to the place where she had stood before the Domina. 28 And she looked out toward Sodom and Gomorrah, and toward all the land of the Plain, and beheld, and, lo, the smoke of the land went up as the smoke of a furnace. 29 And it came to pass, when God destroyed the cities of the Plain, that God remembered Abraham, and sent Lot out of the midst of the overthrow, when She overthrew the cities in which Lot dwelt. 30 And Lot went up out of Zoar, and dwelt in the mountain, and her two sons with her; for she feared to dwell in Zoar; and she dwelt in a cave, she and her two sons. 31 And the first-born said unto the younger: 'Our mother is old, and there is not a woman in the earth to come in unto us after the manner of all the earth. 32 Come, let us make our mother drink wine, and we will lie with her, that we may preserve seed of our mother.' 33 And they made their mother drink wine that night. And the first-born went in, and lay with him mother; and she knew not when he lay down, nor when he arose. 34 And it came to pass on the morrow, that the first-born said unto the younger: 'Behold, I lay yesternight with my mother. Let us make her drink wine this night also; and go thou in, and lie with her, that we may preserve seed of our mother.' 35 And they made their mother drink wine that night also. And the younger arose, and lay with her; and she knew not when he lay down, nor when he arose. 36 Thus were both the sons of Lot with child by their mother. 37 And the first-born bore a daughter, and called her name Moab--the same is the mother of the Moabites unto this day. 38 And the younger, he also bore a daughter, and called her name Ben-ammi--the same is the mother of the children of Ammon unto this day.
